reviewText:
I am not sure how to approach this review. I rarely write these anyway, but I find this game to be particularly interesting to discuss.

First of all, it is a great idea, and fun to play.

That said, BlackJack, particularly, became utterly unplayable a few days prior to the writing of this review. Tables could not be joined; people had to leave chips on the table; dealers just disappeared into thin air.

Normally, I would chalk it up to some bugs, but there is a principle of great importance here:

If you put your chips on that table, and that table stops working, I don't care if it is 1 cent or 1 billion of them, you should not lose that money because the game fails.

I am incredibly frustrated by the fact that the game came out of alpha, and this is the result. They can NOT charge money for a broken game in this regard. Every casino game needs to be very secure and stable before they begin asking for our cents.

The game will charge a Steam account for the purchase of chips. How can they charge for the purchase of chips when you are forced by fault of the game to leave chips on the table when it locks up?

I love the concept. I am irritated beyond belief (as are most players in the place lately) with the bugged out, game crushing, problems.

Summary: I wouldn't advise placing a bet until I've interrogated everyone in the room to be sure things are working right at the time you are considering joining a game.

reviewText:
UPDATE::: The devs have seen it fit to immediately ban me from their discusson board after this review was posted. For that I warn folks who have issues to be careful speaking up. Seems this Dev likes their dirty tricks when they don't want their filthy laundry aired out.


This is my final review edit. After enough time with four kings, I have decided they have completely lost touch with the fanbase who supported them from day one. Just as they did on playstion home for six long years.

Im going to be honest here, I'm not liking the way things are going. I thought after they had their time with playstation home, we'd see changes that showed they learned their lesson last time from customer feedback.

I remember a time when DL had a casino on ps home, it was an avitar social world with literally hundreds of mini games and places to chat and play. Game themed rooms and more. They also had a casino there and they did the same thing with chips there. The games there were PLAUGED with bugs and cheaters, very little was done. However they had no issue releasing an apartment for over 50 dollars that came with the same games you already had access to in their casino and they REFUSED to change the pricing even with such negative feedback. Oh and might I add, the people who were stupid enough to buy it lost those items anyway when ps home closed it's doors this past march.

People lost thousands of chips with no rembursement, and the tournaments were a joke. You had to pay 4.99 for a tournament bracelet with no guarantee of any reward. Just a pat on the back for those who didnt make the cut, while they pocketed their real money.


I was much happier with this game during EA. Now? Theyre making the game completely un fun by catering to the new players they want to spend money. Bingo nerfs are beyond terrible.

Im now seated at a progressive game with over 25 players. The pot would usually be over 100k. It isn't even breaking 40k right now...and rp payouts are the same as the main floor games.

The people who bought in during early access are being pushed away to cater to the casual player with a spending problem.

I have taken a break from four kings and returned today to see if the nerfs were truly as bad as they say, I'm unhappy to report they are far worse than what players are complaining about. I remember sitting at bingo for hours, and not having this back of luck either. One could say it comes and it goes, but this is just ridiculous.

I was quick to respond to a gent who made a post on how this game is not only exploiting potential gambling addicts, but nothing more than a cash grab. I really would like to recall that person's username, so I can apologize and say they might be right.

Because the players who bought into this game and made is possible for it to even make it out of early access are being disregarded. If this is what developers plan to do to people who buy into their games in order to support a title, I am swearing off EA games entirely. Because this seems to be a NASTY habit with devs on here. They bend over backwards during EA, but after they get your money all bets are off.

reviewText:
I honestly downloaded this casino with low expectations. Especially after I started the game, entered my info and was expected to get a confirmation email that I had to use to verify myself. I never got it. So I tried logging into the casino anyway, and got in!

So I created my avatar, got my initial set of quests, which involved going into the various parts of the casino to get free coins, which I did to humor the developers attempt at a psuedo-tutorial. Got my money and proceeded to try out the various casino games.

The slot games were pretty good. I won reasonably enough but it was still a slow bleed of coins. Which I actually liked. It wasn't like Facebook slots where you lose everything in an hour, nor was it so generous that they were practically just free ATM machines.

You won enough to keep playing, even some nice big wins and bonus games, and yet lost enough to keep it real.

I then went to play some bingo. The buy-in was a bit pricey, but it was well designed and fun to play as well. Being a semi-senior citizen myself I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was at a good reasonable pace that I could keep up with four cards yet at a good enough pace to keep you daubing those numbers.

Even though they have multi-player blackjack and poker rooms, I played some video poker and blackjack to get the feel of things there.

The video blackjack was novel in that you played all 5 player slots against the dealer, and it was quite fun doing it that way. This was the ony time that I actually felt that the game was actually working against the players in that in playing around 30 hands the dealer never busted once, even when its face card was a 5 or 6, but I still won enough to play a good amount of time without feeling too cheated since I was playing 5 hands to its 1.

Next I went to the video poker Jacks or Better machine which I personally felt was the one type of game where you can truly see how stacked the games are against players....and I was shocked....

I don't even like video poker, but I ended up playing it for the next two hours. The odds were truly nearly perfect. I was even able to make a few inside straights, a handful of flushes on two card draws, and even keeping pairs of low cards was a reasonable and winnable strategy.

It was a thing of beauty. An honest, true to the odds video poker game. When I looked up and it was after midnight on a work night and I had played two hours on a casino game that I truly hated I was sold.

This is a good attempt at casino games, where their offerings are, at this point and time, honest and true to the odds, and actually pretty darn fun to play. I was truly shocked.

The real money shop is very reasonably priced, even better than Facebook casino's and its very liberal about giving you free coins as you play.

All in all I had a good time and was truly shocked that I did, and that I want to play again and try out other games. And I want to play more video poker...which I can't believe I'm actually saying....

So yeah...Four Kings Casino is truly in a world of its own compared to other casino-type games out there, and if you're in the least bit interested in it then it's definitely worth downloading and checking out for yourself.

reviewText:
Considering this game costs nothing. Unlike other Free Casino/Poker games, this one doesn't press you for real-world cash to actually play the game. Which instantly impressed me. You're able to spend your initial starting cash however you please, with a variety of different casino games on offer, all with reasonable in-game costs and payouts.

It has a generous system of earnings, giving you free credits every 15 minutes and an objectives system that allows you to earn extra in-game cash for completing various tasks in the games and around the virtual casino.

With all this in mind, and the overall quality of the game-world, balance and mechanics. For a FREE game, I'm incredibly impressed with it. It has the addicting nature of online gambing without the home-destroying nature of online gambling... unless you stop going to work because you sink all of your time into this game, but still thoroughly enjoyable if you're into casino games but don't want to spend your real world money on anything other than a sense of fashion for your casino avatar, I'd highly suggest giving this a go.

reviewText:
This is not your typical casino slot game, where you are playing all by yourself.  This is an MMORPG that happens to be set in a casino.  LIke regular casino slot games, it is expected that you will lose your chips, and be expected to buy more.

The Devs have created a nice variety of games, and are working to add more.  However, the major draw for this game is the player interaction.

Now, like any MMORPG, you're going to have your bad apples, the players who just want to cause trouble.  But, on the whole, the players are a good group, and it is fun to interact with people from around the world.

You also have the fun of creating your avatar, and buying various clothing options.  There are items available for real money, and also items available for RP - the reward points you earn when you win in the casino.

Just don't expect the game to be something it's not, and expect to spend money on chips if you play a lot, and enjoy the aspects of the game that are truly exceptional.  Hope to see you there.

reviewText:
From one of the old 'big dogs' of Playstation Home, Four Kings is a solid casino title, with a lot to offer, but a fair few minor flaws.  I haven't tested every single title, but after spending a chunk of time on several, I can say the following:

Pros:
A good set of titles that all function well; poker is of course only as good as the players you get, but all the basic functionality and pomp is here, combined with the daily tasks and tier increases that made PS Home attractive for folks like me.  It is, in essence, a wide array of gambling options with level ups and leveling bonuses.  That's kind of awesome.

Regular influx of chips.  Playing for free long-term is entirely possible due to getting a decent chunk of chips for free from a number of resources (daily super slots, daily/weekly tasks for more chips, 250 chips every 15 minutes in game), which keeps the title from feeling locked off to any reasonable extent.

Looks great.  Not Skyrim-with-a-million-graphics-mods great, but there's obviously been a lot of work to make the Four Kings look interesting, like the kind of place you could go for a vacation.

Cons
Lack of counter of autoplay.  This is a minor quibble but it does frustrate.  I like to play the machine game 'Instant Keno', and it's a bit annoying that when I select the autoplay option that until it gets to the final play, I have no visual indicator how many runs I have left.

Wasted space.  I love the nightclub and the apartment!  They look great, and again bring me back to what I liked about Playstation Home.  Except, they have no purpose at present.  The nightclub has the same music as the rest of the game.  The DJ booth, the bars, all have no interactivity.  The apartment is arguably worse, in that while it looks lovely, there's no way to interact with anything in this allegedly personal space, not even the televisions that look for all the world like they SHOULD be interactive.  I don't want these spaces excized, mind you; it helps to separate the title from generic casino titles in a similar vein, but all of the above needs SOME measure of interaction.  Mini-games, additional places to spend chips/RP/etc, looping videos, new music, I don't care what.  But for it to be lacking all of that makes it little more than window dressing.

Limited spending options.  At present, chips let you play games, winning gives you RP, which can be used to buy a SMALL handful of avatar items, and if you earn X amount in a single month, you get VIP access for a month.  And... that's it.  Can't upgrade your apartment, avatar options are super limited, no special entertainment options for expending RP, etc, etc.  I hope this changes, as there's a lot of room here for enhancement of the overall experience beyond the casino games (which, again, work great and are decently diverse).


Overall, the game is a recommend.  Yes, it has flaws, and I hope to see the title expand a LOT.  But what is there right now is a complete gambling title with solid gameplay in a good environment with countless options for snagging more chips for free and getting your fix on for the day.  And for an entry price of free, it's hard not to say give it a shot.

reviewText:
If you like gambling you can't really go wrong trying this game. This is a fine start to a possibly great casino game.  I spend most of my time at the Blackjack table, Poker table, or the random daily quest games.

- Pros:
Fun.
People are nice that I have met.
Cosmetics are purchasable with earnable credits in-game.
A free game of poker everyday.

- Cons:
Chips are slow to aquire if you are out.
The UI is a bit lacking and sometimes hard to deal with.
Cosmetic selection could be larger and models/graphics could be better. (But thats nit-picking)
Poker room is far to small, has very fast blind structure, only sit-n-go, one buy-in bracket, and no other games but Texas Holdem.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is everything it promises. A classy casino with traditional casino games, a VIP lounge, hotel rooms, poker tables, with more planned.

Pros
___

-Realistic games, from periodically shuffling the deck in blackjack, to the betting ranges and free spins with a massive amount of lines to hit on within the slot machines, the games have a nice, realistic feel to them.
-Population is currently rising, making this community driven game even more fun.
-Awkward Dancing .

Cons
___
-Currently, the variety for slots and machine games is limited. The devs DO, however, have intentions to implement more slot machine varieties as well as other games.
-Some interface issues. Poker in particular has some issues which makes the game less smooth to play, such as all-in not showing the amount all-in'd for.


The devs are dedicated, and often hang out in the game talking to the players. I got to talk with one of the developers about the future of the game, and there's a couple of things to look forward to.

- The Event Room. The future of this room will hold random events, and potentially be used to play games not currently in the casino.
- Free to play access. While playing in development is fun, and will translate into in-casino rewards upon release, this game will eventually be free to play. You can hop on with some buddies and hit the virtual casino for a night.

This game is what it promises ; A multiplayer casino with realistic games to play with friends.

reviewText:
*Edit - I removed the con about Bingo because it seems they have been working on it constantly for the better. *Yay*


Alright, so I figure ill just say this is by far one of the better free casino style games i've played. So with that being said, ill give you all a Pros/Cons list.

PROS
1- *AMAZING COMMUNITY* - the devs are vocal with the community and are actually in game talking with players, I had a great conversation with one not long before posting this, which made me decide to actually post this review. This alone should be enough for you to at least check out this community.

2- Assortment of games - Games from Video Poker, blackjack, Keno, Slots and various table games.  Pretty much you'll find the most common table games

3- Atmosphere - The piano music playing casually in the background while playing Baccarat. Or when you walk by the bar and see some players having a casual chat about their luck. This game completely nails the feeling if being inside a casino.


Cons - honestly not really things which ruin the game or make it bad, just small quality of life things which can honestly be patched in over time. *shortly before this posting the bingo room had a patch already fixing one of my biggest gripes*


1- Running animation - good lord the run cycle on player models.... I just feel they need to be redone completely.


There's some various tiny things with the player model and items, but its so minor I don't feel the need to bring it up.



Overall feeling about the game?? I highly suggest anyone thats interested in playing an accurate casino style game download and try playing. You have nothing to loose except your chips if you're not lucky!!  Like no joke, its free and amazing for what it is. 9/10

reviewText:
I was very skeptical before I installed this, but turns out that I enjoy this game a lot. I've learned how to play craps (steam might censor that) from this game and the next time I go to our local casino I can actually play it with my buddy. This game features the following games;
Baccarat (VIP room)
Big Six Wheel
Blackjack
Bingo
Craps
Jacks or Better
Keno
Poker
Roulette
Slots (4 Kinds)
Video Blackjack
Video Poker
War
After creating your character, you are placed inside a casino with 4 wings that branch off the main 2 floor lobby. If you get lost, you are provided with a map that allows for fast travel. The game starts you off with 20,000 chips and has verious ways to earn free chips should you find your self down on your luck. The game keeps track of stats for each game you play. There's a leader board for each game and global score that resets each month. There are daily and weekly tasks that grant additional chips. Also there's a lot of avatar customization that I won't get into.

Solid 30+ FPS and 25 Ping for Central USDecent graphic options
No 5.1 or 7.1 ss support
Allows keybindings to be changed
Can report bugs in options menu
Has Steam achievements
Has Steam cards

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are a true gambling person, you'll love this game.  If  like me you were looking for a fun  way to pretend to  gamble then  do not buy this game because once out of Early Access it could end up costing you a lot of money if you continue to play the game.  During Early Access you can earn small amounts of chips  (usually  25 chips at a time) for doing   several things like visiting certain area's of the casino, plus you can earn the same number of  chips  for every 15 minutes you spend in game.  When you  enter the Casino after purchasing the game you  are given 1000 chips.

My first love is  slots, so  I casually ran over to the slots and   after 10 spins  I'd spent  virtually all of my chips.   Thankfully, during the  Early Acess phase you can get more chips for   very little money; i.e.  there are several selections ranging from 500 chips to 40 000 chips each one of which  costs you $0.01 to purchase. This amount is deducted from your Steam wallet.   Once early access is over these will undoubtably change and cost much more.  Sadly, like any gambling den, the odds are always stacked against you.

After the 10 turns on the  slots, with virtually no chips left  and not wanting to wait around for  almost an hour before I could get  a couple  more spins, I left, then rejoined the following day because I was under the impression that during Early Access we would be given   1000 chips every  day, but this was not the case (I purchased the  basic game plus the cheaper of the dlc's, (costing me a total of just over £16).

I don't know whether   you can or will be able to convert  any winnings  to  real money, but even if you were, it's only a  lucky few that would ever manage to get any real money back.

Personally I'm really disappointed with this game.  I was  hoping to be able to play a wide range of different slot machines,  but there was little  variety to be found, plus until I decided to buy the  highest  slection of chips I only had enough for two spins and  four goes on the roulette table (which has a minimum bet of 10 chips).

Part way through my second visit there was a server reboot.  I was given literally a  minute's warning in which I was asked to log off.  As I was part way through a gamble  when this occured I wasn't    pleased.

Despite it being in Early Access, so by definition  not a completed game, I can't recommend this game to anyone but   hardened gamblers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An interesting hybrid between an MMO and a Facebook casino game, Four Kings adds a social element that is missing from those games. Reminds me a bit of the long since cancelled This is Vegas but multiplayer. In this state, there is a lot of variety in the different types of casino games, even if they suffer from the major population issue mentioned below. But at least it isn't just limited to a few of them. Best part is that you don't have multiple spam messages all along your Facebook wall from your parents trying to get chips from you.

Game runs fine on my machine at least and save for one period where I had issues loading the character customizer, everything is fine on a technical standpoint.

The only thing holding the game back is its lack of players, which due to the social nature of the game seriously harms the game even in this Early Access state. Hopefully once it launches people will give it a look. Maybe if Digital Leisure adds crafting and zombies, people will play it. :)

Some suggestions to the developer for release and beyond:
Figure out some reason for people to use the nightclub, whether its a drink-serving minigame to earn chips or something else worthwile. Seems useless at this point in time. Same with the Hotel Room. I'd love a GTA style TV where you watch pre-made shows but that's way too expensive for this kind of indie development studio. A possible area for user-generated content perhaps?

More slot and video blackjack variations.

Poker and Blackjack tournaments.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very basic sim with very little excitement.  Might be better with consistent players, but probably not much.  All the games are very generic, without any of the themes or personality that make casinos fun.

The poker room is pretty disappointing, and I don't see any sign in the early access notes of there being plans for any sort of major overhaul here. It's not at all like an actual casino poker room, and seems like it's been designed by someone who doesn't know much about poker. There is no cash games, only sit-and-go style tournaments with extremely fast blind levels that tend to turn the game into an all-in festival within minutes. There is no variety in games. The tables don't even have enough seats for a typical casino poker game. The poker setup seems geared toward getting games over with as quickly as possible.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is probably one of the easiest games I've found to just hop on for an hour or so a day and just have some fun.
The game is fairly well optimised after one of the latest patches, the game is now most certainly where it needs to be in terms of performace.

The gameplay is so reliable and enjoyable, the only downside as many have said is the slots. Slots is the easiest game to sink money and time into and the current machine is rather lackluster. I'm aware a new machine is on it's way and that's what I'm most excited for.

There is some issues with the games UI still and quite a few issues regarding the VIP system and everything relating that is rather confusing and not very well explained.

The customisation of the characters is very strong and enjoyable, there is a lot of options regarding your style and the currency to buy items is a little hard to get however it's very rewarding when you finally get the item you have wanted.


My biggest gripe is the VIP system and that is runs on a server based clock and if you manage to get VIP one day before the end of the month you get it for only that one day, then when the reset rolls around it clocks you back to normal status.
Even if you purchased one of the dlc packs for a month of VIP it resets you to normal status when the monthly reset happens - so if you purchase it at a bad time you could only get 5 days of VIP or however long untill the month changes.

This is a game I have been waiting for, and for a very long time. I am so glad it has finally come and it is so enjoyable. The updates are frequent however often not many new features as there is a lot of work to be done on the backend of the game and the new games etc take a very long time to produce.
The payouts are balance, the game is fun, and the servers are fast.

A great game in my opinion and I'm glad I bought into the beta before it went F2P because I got so much out of it. A must buy for any gambling enthusiast or card guys.

reviewText:
Finally, a well designed walk around casino for PC. Remember Ceasars Palace? That was a good game made 15 years ago and there hasn't been something similar until now. The Four Kings is a huge casino and you can walk up to any table/machine and play it. 10/10

You start with 10k chips and can purchase 400k for $20. If you're smart, that 400k will last an extremely long time even with max bets. For a free game, the 10k can last you a long time. That's a pretty incredible deal. Don't like it? Stop playing, or decide to spend $20 for the largest package of chips. The avatars are cheap and you can earn quite a few perks at the poker and blackjack tables for free. $20 out of the gate is very fair.

There's tons of selection of games. Multiplayer makes this game awesome. You can sit down at a blackjack, craps, poker, roulette, war and money wheel and even bingo with real people. First person table view is excellent. Tired of playing? Go for a walk and sit down on a couch, eat some lunch, and come back. There's also a VIP area and many shops to buy things for your avatar. Call your friends up and play poker together with other people online.

Yes, this game requires major computer resources as people are saying, so if you can't handle it turn them to low in the settings.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Some of you coming from the PS3 may remember the casino from PSHome made by Digital Leisure as the biggest rip off on there. The games that were horribly in the favor of the house. It was a fun place to hang out, but spend any real money and watch it go quick.

That isn't the case with 4 Kings. They seem to have more realistic odds so the games are more fun to play. You aren't loosing to the dealer every hand. At this point there are still bugs to work out, but it's a good place to hang out,  play with friends, and make some new ones.

To the home users hope to see you there. You can get this game free if you haven't already by visiting the DL site, and sending your psn info from the casino there.

reviewText:
If you're looking for a decent casino game which is fun, stable and playable with friends, keep looking, because this is not the game you're looking for.

The game is not stable at all, I felt like I was testing an unreleased game. Out of thin air crashs, freezing game tables, countless lost chips due to casino's errors, took away the tad bit joy it created.

Shall I mention that the BJ dealer is cheating like %80 of the time? Let me. This one time, I am playing table limit, my hand is 20, dealer's upcard is 3. OK, losing is something possible and acceptible, even in this situation, but what is 3 + 2 + 2 + 3 + 6 + 5 = 21? How's that even possible? Every single time I hit on 12-13 I bust, when dealer hits, it's a 21.

I've been playing BJ and frequenting casinos more than seven years, and believe me, I've never seen a shameless blatantly cheating BJ like this.

Video BJ is weird though, I presume devs forgot to fix that machine, nearly %60 of the time dealer busts.

Video Poker? Scam of the century. Lot less profitable than real casinos.

It's a game after all, one should get free chips to sustain a cashroll, or enough to create a base when outta chips. (which is a strong probability with cheating machines)  All you get is 1000 from daily if you've log in on consecutive days, 250 free chips every 15 minutes, or various amounts from daily tasks (average 800 chips daily).

reviewText: Easily one of the best social gambling games Ive ever played. You create a character, roam around a casino and play various casino games such as Roulette, Slots, Blackjack, Poker, and so on. You unlock items for your character as you play games and reach milestones and get achievements. There is zero pay 2 win aspects to the game. Its free, you have the choice to buy chips, but you arent forced to. Not only are you not forced to buy chips, you get free chips every 15 minutes plus free chips from doing daily/weekly activities which vary from playing 5 hands of Blackjack to just simply changing your outfit.\n\nAll in all this is an extremely fun and addicting game and the fact that its free2play is a huge bonus. This game does not deserve the negative reviews it has recieved so do not listen to the reviews. Download the game for yourself and give it a try. Better yet, grab a couple friends and gamble together!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is, without a doubt, the best early access game I've ever bought. If you're familiar with the PS3 Home casino, or even if you're not, you'll love this game.

I took a risk buying this, as I don't usually expect much from early access, but this really surprised me. From the couple of hours of playing this, I've experienced stable, smooth, solid gameplay. I've tried all games in the casino, and they all work without a single hitch. If it didn't even say it was early access, I wouldn't have even known that it was.

Good points:
- Has a nice atmosphere, really feels like a nice place to hang out
- Gameplay is smooth
- Control/movement is great
- Blackjack
- The community who play regularly are really nice

Improvement suggestions:
- Avatar customisation is lacking
- Lack of people to talk to (will improve with popularity hopefully!)
- Lack of people to play Poker with
- Chat/messaging system is a slightly buggy

If you're looking for a great casino game, this is the one. You can have a great casino experience for a few dollars. It's definitely worth buying now and investing for the future - I see great things ahead! Awesome job devs!

reviewText:
While there are many friendly people on the network, the suspicion that the odds have been stacked in the house's favor makes the game an overall unenjoyable experience.

Playing over 10 hours of blackjack following standard basic strategy outlined by wizardofodds.com, my average losses were roughly 50,000 chips an hour. This puts the house edge of blackjack at over 10%, which in no variation of game rules is reasonable. Sitting at any table game will cause nothing but frustration for you, or the players beside you. It's no surprise that the only game played by the regulars is poker, which is played against other players, not the house.

If you choose to play this game, play it for the social experience, not for the excitement that a fair casino offers. There will not be enough enjoyment to justify the time, energy, and money you dump into the game.

While I have enough chips in my account to bleed out for the next six months, I have instead decided to uninstall this game in favor of more fruitful pursuits.

Social experience: 9/10
Gambling experience 2/10

reviewText:
This game is in its early stages. I'm sure with a couple of patches we'll see this as a fully functional game.
As an avid casino player having played, Reel Deal Vegas/Live (when it was open), Casino RPG, and Facebook casino games I can tell you that this is one of the best casino games out there. The navigation takes a bit of getting use to and clicking (E) to interact with tables and the video machines is cumbersome but still enjoy it nonetheless a very beautiful casino. I love the fact that there's alot of detail that went into there table games and the fact that this casino has an actual bingo room. You can even sit on the chairs provided and have a hotel room which you can access.
I'm hoping in the future they have more to customize such as changing or upgrading your room, etc. Of course more slots and more variety of table games. its def on the right path though

the only heartburn I have with it is the microtransactions, I feel they could go the subscription route but thats just me.

reviewText:
Great time waster.

I really didn't expect to have much fun with this game and thought it was going to be really geared towards spending your money. The devs made it incredibly easy to enjoy this game without spending a dime. You get free chips regularly, every 15 minutes or so, there's multiple free daily things to get chips (poker, slots) and some of the jackpots you can hit pay out tons. If you are inclined to spend money on this game it's incredibly cheap, I was actually surprised at how little they charge for chips, cosmetic items are really the only thing with a mention worthy price tag. Devs are on regularly and actively listening to feedback and bug reports. It also has a really large community for being out for a whole two days. I can only see this becoming more enjoyable.

If you enjoy gambling but you're a cheap ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, this game is for you.

reviewText:
I'll start off by saying I reccomend this game but I would give it a 6/10 overall.
I am a ps4 player who played for about a month put $30 into the game and got over 150k rp within that time period.
We'll start with the bads,
gameplay gets a 4/10... no matter what you play the odds are against you just like a real casino making it nearly impossible to build up a decent amount of chips even from smart bets. Another big thing is the constant glitches and bugs riddled throughout the game that can make it obnoxious to play at times and even cause to lose chips. You can play this game for free, but the amount of chips they supply you with are minimal and very easy to lose so most likely this will be a pay to play game for you. The four points I gave it is simply because it is a casino and who doesn't love gambling.
graphics gets a 7/10... I did enjoy the graphics although there are many bugs with the emotes and things seem to be pretty cartoony (hey what do you expect) it's not very realistic but it gets the job done.
customer service gets a 9/10... they are quick to refund lost chips due to their glitches and provide needed help, but one night I had a huge error in the game and they simply ignored my direct messages on facebook to their company (their page isn't even busy) which simply cannot allow me to give them a 10/10.

This game is very addicting but can also be a money sink which is bad because in reality their prices for chips are absolutely horrible and if you aren't careful about your bets you could blow through $20 in a few days. In the end i decided the game was pointless and just decided to go all in on one number on roulette (75 spins) 10k bet and it didn't hit my number a single time (WHAT ARE THE ODDS??). So I would say check this game out it's pretty fun for a while but whatever you do don't put money into this rigged game as you will never win.

reviewText: Awesome game!!! I found The Four Kings Casino while searching for a game i could play together with my son ... and i've found the best place to play several casino games, hang out with my son & meet other people from all around the world :). It's a very addictive game... a place where i wish to come back every day and whenever i can to play & meet my friends. If you should get tired of playing & chatting you even have a hotel room where you can have some time for yourself.\nTrue, this game also has bugs and glitches, such as people getting disconnected (if you loose chips don't worry, i've lost many and all of them have been refunded), but this game has a good Team of dedicated Developers who care about making this game a wonderfull experience for everyone :)

reviewText:
Digital Leisure and i go back a while.  About 2 years or more to be more exact.  So, back then, and even earlier, there was this thing called Playstation Home, and it was a place where you could play games, watch videos on new game/movie releases, meet people, socialize, and do other things as well.  It was an amazing place and the best part was just how you could be what you wanted to be, although some times it did have a price tag on it, and have fun.  One of the many companies I remembered was DL.   They were well known for having their Casino hub, and a lot of people liked them for it.   Now, back then, I was able to play as well, and although I spent more money than I would like to admit, I did have fun and once you got to a certain tier/level, you never had to worry about losing too much money because you just had to play smart and not be an idiot.


Well that was nice and all but PSH was shutdown because Sony wasn't making enough money or something and all that money we spent, went bye bye.   Now, back to the present.  We have this Casino game, back up and free to play, and it has the same feel as the other casino did.   So my review is biased slightly because I really loved it back then and am happy to see it now.   Due to that, I will keep the review part, short and brief.


Pros:
Has many different gambling games and slots
Nice way to customize your avatar in terms fo looks
rewards for winning things or achieving things
ways to earn free chips so you can still play
Much much cheaper prices for chips than when it was on PSH
Visuals are pretty but
Con:

Visuals are pretty, but if you put on max or near max, then you will lag, badly.  Its just not that well optimzied but who cares, its all about the gambling, not the visuals
Easy to lose money fast if you don't know what you are doing


Overall, this is very much like how Home was but with a few changes that make it nice.   And yes you can still dance in front of people and be a weirdo.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFour Kings Casino is probably the best simulated casino style multiplayer game to date. Most typical casino games are present and the play style is that of an mmo with customizable avatars ect allowing you to navigate the realistic virtual casino setting and join the different games as you choose. Gameplay is very similar to the Digital Leisure casino that was part of playstation home, for those that played that, only graphically better. Bugs have been minimal over the several hours I've played so far and the game is pretty polished for the first few days of early access beta. I would definitely recommend this game for casual players who enjoy both casino style gaming and social mmo type game mechanics. My only caveat is that this game is not strictly a free to play game, but after its offical launch will be a microtransaction model wherein you have the option of  purchasing additional casino chips to augment or replenish your current holdings. As with any game of this nature the inherent cost will depend on what you decide to spend, so amongst those gamers who inexplicably expect to enjoy playing polished multiplayer games without having to financially support them I'm sure there will be complaining.

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game. I'm a big fan of casino games in general. I don't gamble much in real life, but it's nice to be able to have fun with little expense. Unfortunately, this game didn't really fit the bill.  From a social aspect, it's fine. Most of the people are nice. The rest of the game though, is severely lacking.

Poker has the same problem it has anywhere else. It's free. People still make boneheaded calls and go all-in with nothing.  The bigger problem is that the only tournament you can play is with 6 people at one table. You start with $50k which would be fine if the blinds didn't go up extremely fast. It makes trying to play a realistic game of poker virtually impossible, as very soon after starting you're pretty much pot committed once you bet anything.

Blackjack is probably the best part of the game though, especially after the last update, it literally feels like the dealer is getting 20 or 21 every other hand. Still, there is money to be made if you know how to play.

That brings me to the worst part of the game, table machines. Slots, keno, video blackjack and video poker are money suckers with what seems like much lower payout percentages than even Vegas. I literally sat there for 30-45 minutes without a single bonus round. Forget trying to bet anything higher than the minimum because you will soon be out of money.  There are only three types of slot machines which gets old really fast especially when none of them pay.  Keno has a minimum bet of $100 and video blackjack has a minimum of $200. With poor payouts, again you will be out of money quickly.  The game also has war, roulette, big wheel, craps and bingo which are all pretty standard.  Again, especially with war, it seems like the more money bet, the lower percentage of times you're going to win.

You have daily tasks to do, receiving $200 for each of the 6. Unfortunately, most of the time you will be spending more than that to complete the tasks. There are weekly tasks, mostly revolving around getting a certain amount of XP. An example of the problem with this is me spending 45 minutes playing a $400 per spin slot machine, losing 40k and gaining a whopping 200xp. That would have been great if the weekly task wasn't 1,000 XP with a few thousand reward for doing so.  There is a VIP section for high rollers but I honestly don't know how people get to be high rollers unless they have spent real money or gotten extremely lucky.

Again, I really wanted to like the game. Unforunately, there is better poker to be had on any online site and the rest of the game is just no fun with the extremely low payouts.  If you're just in it for the social aspect and don't mind betting small, go for it. Otherwise, I'd stick with other products.

reviewText:
The game is a combination of Second Life and a common Casino Game. I like the idea and I think the developers' execution is well done. Using a laptop with HD3000 chip, I cannot rate the graphics.

Plus:
- The diversity of casino games is very good and even better than the average casino-only games.
- The socializing is eased as a HUD is implemented similar to MMORPGs with some default mimics (Dance, Say Hello, Wave the hand, ...).
- Easy start with start chips and the support through chip income with daily quests. If you do not want to spend hours on gambling, than I think it should be enough.

Neutral:
- The execution time of the casino table games is poor. It is onlz neutral, as the developer have to ensure that all players are on the same level all the times. But in a real live casino, the execution is mind blowing contrary to this game.
- The party room seems unecessary, as there is never one in it. On first sight, this room also does not provide any benefit or interesting spot.
- 3 Minutes to wait when all players are there to start a round of Bingo? That's far too high!

Minus:
Basically the casino consists of 5 rooms (hopefully I counted correctly). However, each room is only accessible via a loading screen. I think this concept is too much outdated to give here any possibilty for an excuse. The casino is not the Venetian and I think the level should be loadable within one go.

reviewText:
Been playing this for a handful of months now. You should have no problem being able to gamble and hang with friends without buying chips if you know how to play the games.  Also if you don't over bet based on the amount of chips you have.  It has 3 different slot games, Video Poker, Video BJ, multiple deck BJ and single handed BJ (in VIP lounge), Texas Hold em, Keno, War, Roulette, Craps, Bingo, Big 6 Wheel, and Baccarat. The game has events on the weekends (same 4 that repeat), daily tasks (quests if you will), and weekly tasks.  The leaderboards reset every 3 months (considered seasons) and I believe there are rewards at the end of each season depending on where you rank in each game and global.

On the downside, there are gliches which is to be expected.  They patch probably once a month, sometimes twice.  There are people that shouldn't be on the game much less within the social/online community like anywhere. Easily can be blocked though.

If you enjoy messing around with gambling then you would probably enjoy this game.

reviewText:
The game itself is nice.  I enjoy the real casino vibe it carries.  Almost all of the social aspects of the game fall totally flat.  Like your complimentary apartment, and the dance club.  There are zero reasons to go there.  I walked around the apartment and you can't do anything except sit on things.  I didn't even notice any customizable aspects to it.

Pros.

Real Casino simulator in how you walk around and play the games.  Seems like most of the games simulate real life fairly well based on my experience with those games.  Poker is always agaisnt players so it is the fairest"
date:
although it falls victim to all fake money poker games out there.

Cons.

Blackjack.  Holy crap... the blackjack.

This game however is totally broken.  The dealer draws to 20 and 21 an INSANE amount of times.  It regularly draws to 20 and 21 with 5 and 6 showing.  The worst cards it can get.  The dealer also ends up with 20+ so often that you simply can't win even a 30 minute sitdown of basic BJ play.  I have played basic BJ rules
recommended: and in real life you can expect losing streaks of up to around 6 hands in a row.  More then that gets mathmatically inplausable
hoursPlayed: although 7 or even 8 could technically happen if you played for long periods of time.  This game however has gone on multiple 10+ hand losing streaks.  I have seen three 10 hand losing streaks in the last 2 days alone and Iv only dared play it a handful of times.  These happen in less then 20 minutes of playing.  The odds of this happening should be impossible
voteText: but it happens regularly.  10 unwinnable hands in a row when you play basic BJ.   I always play solo at the table to exclude any player errors.  Do NOT play BJ in this game.  Unless you are only going to play 3 or 4 hands and pray for a win.  But for real long term tight play

reviewText:
I went into this game expecting total ♥♥♥♥♥, but it's actually surprisingly fun. Especially with friends.

You get to customize a character, you have your own hotel room, the environments are beautiful, and the games are pretty damn entertaining. I expected to have microtransactions shoved down my throat at every turn, but the starting money is generous and unless you really suck at gambling, it's hard to lose those starting funds (free chips every 15 minutes, free bingo games, chips lying around the casino, and dailies/monthies help earn anything lost back as well). Only other transactions were minor and completely optional, mostly cosmetic.

I don't have many complaints, honestly. I hope to see this game grow and improve, as there's plenty of ways they can expand the experience. I might actually put money into the game purely to support the model they have going. Keep up the good work, guys.

In short: 10/10 would make friends ragequit by beating their ♥♥♥ at bingo again.

reviewText:
** IMPORTANT REVIEW**   POSITIVE BUT ALSO VERY NEGATIVE!

Ok, straight fowardly, this game is fun and enjoyable BUT, there is a huge problem with tables glitching / freezeing and it results in losts chips. So far I have had the game for only 2 DAYS, 2 DAYS!!!!!!............and i have lost over 20000 chips from glitches. I foolishly decided to purchase some more chips with real money just to enjoy another game of poker, but OF COURSE the table froze and everyone lost 5000 chips, all 6 players. I see the game has only been released since june the 1st, but yeah, the game devs are definitely going to want this fixed like yesterday or this game will be useless.

Now, let me say this. These table glitch / freeze are the only issue i have with the game, other then that, the game is great. I'm forced to leave a negative review because of these very frequent very frustrating crashes that steal my chips, WHEN I WAS WINNING THE POKER Game. This turns a very fun game into a frustrating anger fueler. lol, seriously tho, fix the f-ing game.

reviewText:
The game looks good and such, community is very friendly but it's main attraction, the gambling, only feels frustrating.
I know that the developers have stated that they do not alter the odds of the various games in any way, but somehow I am having a hard time believing that. I've been to plenty of casinos in different countries and I've never felt as ♥♥♥♥ed over as I did playing this game. Incredible draws by the dealer in Blackjack, the dices in craps seem to have the ability to never roll what you want and so on and so forth.

It's not a bad looking game and it's fun to chat with the other players, but the gambling in this casino game is so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ed horrendeous that I can not recommend anyone to play it!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFor early access I am very impressed. If you like casinos/casino games this is well done. The social interaction factor is a great addition. I can't wait to see what the future holds for this game. However, I am a bit concerned about the requirement in the VIP status section that states minimum 30 day membership." For those of us who had enough faith in you to buy in as early access founders are you intending to charge a monthly membership fee? Considering your all in pass was almost as much as GTA V I think you would be making a critical error to charge founding members a monthly fee. Biting the hand that fed you could cause a rather nasty backlash. Example being what happened when Steam decided to allow charging a fee for Elder Scrolls V Skyrim mods. That really kicked the hornets’ nest and they quickly rescinded. Think about it gentlemen."

reviewText:
A pretty decent game that was fun for a day.
It's free and easy to pick up since you have explanations for each gametype.

Unfortunately, once you lose all your chips (which is rather easy because luck seems to never be on your side, unless you play poker which is obviously more skill oriented) you will have to wait 15 minutes for 250 Chips.
To put that into perspective: The buy-in for Poker is 5k. The buy-in for Bingo ranges from 1k to 5k.
Also, this timer does not count down while offline.
There is also a shop for microtransactions (money as well as cosmetics) but honestly who uses that?

Still overall a great gambling game, if you know how to not waste 100k in 10 minutes.

reviewText: The Four Kings Casino And Slots\n\nNot the worst free casino game I've ever played. F2P with chips and vanity items for sale with real money. Free 250 chips every 15 minutes. Mediocre customization compared to 80% of games on the market. The deciding factor for me was that although I get 250 chips every 15 minutes, buy-ins and minimum bets are much too high. 50 chips for a hand of war, 5000 chips for a sit and go 6 man poker game (besides the once-a-day freebie poker table), 200 per hand of video poker? I also couldn't find the payout table for the slot machine but that might just be a PEBKAC error. They really need to add about 3 floors to their casino with different stake levels on each floor. Currently not a recommendation but if they make the stakes lower so you can choose to play for fun and socializing instead of topping leaderboards I might change it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Four Kings Casino is the re-incarnation of the PS Home casino on PC (for now). A PS4 version is planned for the future. I must admit I was skeptical at first. Partly because I am not much of a gambler. But I wanted to be able to give our readers at yourpshome.net an insight as to what it was all about. Guess what? I got sucked in :)

First of all, I was surprised at just how far this project has come along. I expected a very tiny begining and was amazed the first time I signed on that a whole casino was in front of me complete with a VIP room and a Club to party in. Now a nice hotel room" (personal space) has been added which means the groundwork has been laid for future expansion.

I orinally intended to just use the "free" or "beta" version
date: but it only took one visit to make me want to upgrade to an "All-In" pass. Well worth it.\n\nSo even if you are not a die-hard gambler
recommended: you might still want to check this out. This isn't a Home replacement but its the best I've seen so far. Check it out. Who knows what the future holds?"

reviewText:
I constantly feel like the blackjack tables are stuck in a cheating loop.
On 5 seperate occassions, I've seen the dealer get a king of hearts and a king of spades, 10 times in a row.

I recorded some of its hands to see what they were like, its starting hand was never below 15 and somehow (despite only having a 13% chance to do so) it would consistently pull a 5 or a 6 to get a 20 or 21. The dealer in Four Kings gets a 20+ more than half of the time after 30 hands and most of those are a starting pair of 10 value cards.

The chances of these things happening aren't impossible, but for my first example, you would literally be more likely to pick an atom in your house at random and then accidently pick it again. And this somehow happened 5 times, if that's not cheating then I must have a luck of about 1 or 2 because I have lost over 100k chips to the blackjack tables.

reviewText:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Gambling game.


Interface/Menu/Settings.

You need to make an account for this game in order to play.
This game is totally for free, however you are able to buy stuff with money.
You can play window mode or fullscreen.
There is alot of resolution sizes.
The sound and music volume has a slidebar.
You are able to change controls.
You can play this game with a xbox controller. With vibration toggle mode.

About the game.

You play with a 3D Character which you are able to customize. You can even unlock new clothes and tools.
You can change Gender/Clothes/effects at any time you wish.
The game can only be played in online mode.
You are able to level up in activities. For whatever reason it is.
You are able to compete other players in some gambling modes.
You are able to add Timestamp" in the chat window.
You can use emotes.
There are alot of different Gambling modes in the game.

Casino slot machines
Bingo (My favourite)
Blackjack
Poker
Roulette
War

And some other activities.
However sometimes it feels that the game is a little too unfair and makes you lose many or multiple times.
On the other hand
date: Casino's never were fair even in real life.\n\nEvery 15 minutes you will get 250 chips for free
recommended:
however these will not stack (which means you have to collect them).
You will also NOT receive the free chips if you are offline. You will only get them if you are online in the game.

You are able to complete tasks to get some more Chips or even clothes.  There are daily and weekly tasks.


Other things.

There are leaderboards for certain Casino games.
There are alot of immature people or people that are offensive and swearing.
Alot of people do not want to sit next or close to someone else. They prefer to sit in the middle
hoursPlayed: or having 1 sit next to them empty or they sit entirely alone.\nThe game is sort of addictive
voteText:
Not because it's a "Gambling" Game. But more it's easy to play and easy pick and leave game. Time goes fast too.

-------------------

I Give this game a 6/10"

reviewText:
A pretty decent game that was fun for a day.
It's free and easy to pick up since you have explanations for each gametype.

Unfortunately, once you lose all your chips (which is rather easy because luck seems to never be on your side, unless you play poker which is obviously more skill oriented) you will have to wait 15 minutes for 250 Chips.
To put that into perspective: The buy-in for Poker is 5k. The buy-in for Bingo ranges from 1k to 5k.
Also, this timer does not count down while offline.
There is also a shop for microtransactions (money as well as cosmetics) but honestly who uses that?

Still overall a great gambling game, if you know how to not waste 100k in 10 minutes.

reviewText:
The game is still going through a rough patch where you can run into some seriously game-breaking bugs, but they are quick to shut down areas of the casino that are effected and then patch it within a day. That being said, they WILL reimburse any chips that you lost to bugs if you send in a ticket, contrary to what many other reviews have claimed.

But aside from the bugs, the game is really quite solid. Most of the time all the games and machines work perfectly fine, and the variety is good. They also run tournaments periodically for when you're feeling a bit more competitive.

So what's the bad then? Since the game is free, they'll try to coax you into buying chips with real money. Now, you're never forced into a situation where buying chips is the only way to continue playing, but if you go broke often it will definitely test your patience. In order to get free chips, you can do both daily and weekly tasks that reward you with chips. After that, you get one Super Slot spin per day. And if you're really desperate, you can collect free chips from an ATM every 15 minutes.

But beyond that the game is reasonably generous. When you win chips, you also slowly build up premium currency. You can win your way into the VIP lounge by playing enough, and many of the cosmetics can be attained by earning achievments.

The social elements of the game feel somewhat forced but that's true of most MMO-styled games.

Overall, if you like casino games, you can't go wrong giving this a try.

reviewText:
I've been reading some of the reviews lately and I honestly don't understand why a lot of people dislike this game. I understand that there can be some compatibility issues within the game, and a list of bugs (especially when it's in early access) but honestly, the whole atmosphere/environment in this game is great.

Obviously, if you're not into games a casino would feature (like poker, blackjack, 6wheel, slots etc) then you'll probably not like this game. But with the features included in this game, such as the limited freeroam offered within a virtual-type casino is quite unique and it gives some quality to the game. This game reminds me of the good old playstation home, it's really nice. I've already invited a handful of friends to play the game with me and they've also enjoyed it. So far, the players within the community are all quite mature and are really enjoying the game.

Although I would like to see if there is some kind of forum or website where you can hand out some suggestions or help in regards to playing the game. If by any chance, someone does have a link, I would appreciate if someone would send me the link.

Anyways, great game guys, I recommend it!

reviewText:
OK time to review this game. I'll give it an nine point one. Fun bingo games that overall pay the best. I'm a pretty fair craps player. I play passline with odds and the come with odds but I swear craps kicks my ♥♥♥. I can't figure this out. I'll Have to go back with a system I guess and try again. Overall the game is a blast and it is cool to walk up to a chick and ask her to dance. Most of the time they don't know how to react. Just don't harrass them, please.
Machine play is pretty normal give and take, I still have not hit a straight!  Good fun and you can spend a few bucks without breaking the bank. Lots of table games that are fun. If you can coerce an invite to the Vip club it gives you a 24 hour pass. That brings with it a Baccarat game and some serious minimums on the other table games. High rollers only (or you can just hang out and see how the other half lives) lol!
Have a little fun, don't get your undies in a bunch. It's just clean fun.
Hope Digital continues to improve the solid product that they have.
P.S. If you bingo, a must have is the $4.95 Auto Marker. You can kick back and watch the numbers come in all marked for you. On the longer games you can wander off, have a smoke, vacuum the living room, etc. come back and presto... all of your cards are marked! Way cool. And I'm not a shill for the Devs. Just tryin' to help! Please don't think I'm trying to sell ♥♥♥♥. You get the marker you'll love it
PPS I hit a straight tonite! celebration time.
PPPS I won on bingo 50000 last nite and 26000 today. Am I on fire or what?

reviewText:
The 'Mixed' status must be the negative first half of the reviews balancing out the positive second half, because I don't see any reasons to down-rate.  Sure it may have had some bugs but any idiot who knows that it's new and relatively unpolished and then spends money on chips that they lose (and didn't have to because chips can easily be earned for free, all the time) and didn't report to the devs, who to their credit are very attentive in-game, deserve the loss and should just downrate themselves.

That being said I'd love to see a little extra in this and hope to eventually!
- The entire upper deck seems like wasted space with those stores that can be accessed from anywhere, even from the game menus, and feel more like placeholders than anything substantial - could the casino be expanded up there with some more variety?
- See above - more variety (would be nice to have more than just one slot machine game for example)
- Interaction beyond just the casino - example, nothing can be done in the apartment other than to sit on things
- Where's the buffet?!

reviewText:
Do you like a good time killer?

Do you like a fun community?

Do you like cards or slots or any other games of chance?

The slot machines and other electronic games are appropriately depressing for going through chips en masse, but the card games are where you can engage and get to know people as much or little as possible.

The developers are very active and keen to help you enjoy yourself. While they are battling some early bugs, (typical of most small market releases) I am pretty sure I will come back to this game again and gain.

reviewText:
I'm not sure why there are so many positive reviews for this game, because I gave it way more of a chance than I would normally for such a lackluster game.

The graphics are taxing on my hardware, despite them being at their lowest.  (for reference I can run Planetside 2 at 35FPS with this rig.)  That is beside the point though.  There is a game here, where you can go almost anywhere you'd go in a normal casino, and you get 250 free chips every 15 minutes.  The theory is solid, but the execution is inevitably boring.

Walking around with 400,000 chips from my slot jackpot, I found that there was absolutely no way to splurge my money.  I played literally every game in the casino 20 or so times and still couldn't throw away my money.  That's not a bad thing, but normally in my situation, a player would be having major fun.  I think it's the fact that there is NOTHING to spend chips on aside from the crappy games that take forever to even get going.  Once I got into the VIP area, I figured all of this would be different... but the VIP area is just the same as the non-VIP area with 2 different games and the same level of boredom.  I would say the rating system kept me going, but there was no actual pride to be had with it... yeah I'm tier 12 at poker.. what do I get?  Nothing.  Tier 25?  Nothing.  Lets not delude the fact that even if there were a prize, there would be nothing to do with it

In summary, the game is a borefest with a casino skin.  If you like sitting around pretending to play poker and blackjack, then this game might be for you.  But if you are a normal human being who enjoys mental stimulation... Steer clear of this waste of time.

reviewText:
From one of the old 'big dogs' of Playstation Home, Four Kings is a solid casino title, with a lot to offer, but a fair few minor flaws.  I haven't tested every single title, but after spending a chunk of time on several, I can say the following:

Pros:
A good set of titles that all function well; poker is of course only as good as the players you get, but all the basic functionality and pomp is here, combined with the daily tasks and tier increases that made PS Home attractive for folks like me.  It is, in essence, a wide array of gambling options with level ups and leveling bonuses.  That's kind of awesome.

Regular influx of chips.  Playing for free long-term is entirely possible due to getting a decent chunk of chips for free from a number of resources (daily super slots, daily/weekly tasks for more chips, 250 chips every 15 minutes in game), which keeps the title from feeling locked off to any reasonable extent.

Looks great.  Not Skyrim-with-a-million-graphics-mods great, but there's obviously been a lot of work to make the Four Kings look interesting, like the kind of place you could go for a vacation.

Cons
Lack of counter of autoplay.  This is a minor quibble but it does frustrate.  I like to play the machine game 'Instant Keno', and it's a bit annoying that when I select the autoplay option that until it gets to the final play, I have no visual indicator how many runs I have left.

Wasted space.  I love the nightclub and the apartment!  They look great, and again bring me back to what I liked about Playstation Home.  Except, they have no purpose at present.  The nightclub has the same music as the rest of the game.  The DJ booth, the bars, all have no interactivity.  The apartment is arguably worse, in that while it looks lovely, there's no way to interact with anything in this allegedly personal space, not even the televisions that look for all the world like they SHOULD be interactive.  I don't want these spaces excized, mind you; it helps to separate the title from generic casino titles in a similar vein, but all of the above needs SOME measure of interaction.  Mini-games, additional places to spend chips/RP/etc, looping videos, new music, I don't care what.  But for it to be lacking all of that makes it little more than window dressing.

Limited spending options.  At present, chips let you play games, winning gives you RP, which can be used to buy a SMALL handful of avatar items, and if you earn X amount in a single month, you get VIP access for a month.  And... that's it.  Can't upgrade your apartment, avatar options are super limited, no special entertainment options for expending RP, etc, etc.  I hope this changes, as there's a lot of room here for enhancement of the overall experience beyond the casino games (which, again, work great and are decently diverse).


Overall, the game is a recommend.  Yes, it has flaws, and I hope to see the title expand a LOT.  But what is there right now is a complete gambling title with solid gameplay in a good environment with countless options for snagging more chips for free and getting your fix on for the day.  And for an entry price of free, it's hard not to say give it a shot.

reviewText:
If you like gambling you can't really go wrong trying this game. This is a fine start to a possibly great casino game.  I spend most of my time at the Blackjack table, Poker table, or the random daily quest games.

Fun.
People are nice that I have met.
Cosmetics are purchasable with earnable credits in-game.
A free game of poker everyday.

- Cons:
Chips are slow to aquire if you are out.
The UI is a bit lacking and sometimes hard to deal with.
Cosmetic selection could be larger and models/graphics could be better. (But thats nit-picking)
Poker room is far to small, has very fast blind structure, only sit-n-go, one buy-in bracket, and no other games but Texas Holdem.

reviewText:
This game has the following:

Many different kinds of gambling, including Roullette, Poker, and Blackjack (and more).

You can wander around! There are rooms you can find on-foot, or you can use your phone.

I recommend this game mostly because I won my 1st table. I found a free table, sucked terribly, went to a $5,000 table, and I saw people come over from the Free Table...whooped all of them, and played many more fullfilling poker games. The Game is Real.

reviewText:
This game has real potential, and a real place in the market seeing as it is the only multiplayer poker game on steam (something we really need).
And while the graphics are pretty, and the idea of the hub world where you can find all the different types of poker is fun, the game is just too shoddy in the technical side of things to be recommended.
Yes, it is in early access and will improve as time goes on, that does not mean a game can be released in a such a ♥♥♥♥ state.
It constantly freezes, players will disappear, it will crash unexpectedly (causing me to lose a lot of chips), and has an atrocious frame rate.
Its not too good from a gameplay perspective, as nearly everyone is playing Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em so you can find barely anyone to play other games with, such as roulette. And when you do want to play Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em, all the tables are taken up!
Overall, the game has real promise, but in its current state, only touch this pile of ♥♥♥♥ with a stick longer than it takes for you to find an empty blackjack table!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An interesting hybrid between an MMO and a Facebook casino game, Four Kings adds a social element that is missing from those games. Reminds me a bit of the long since cancelled This is Vegas but multiplayer. In this state, there is a lot of variety in the different types of casino games, even if they suffer from the major population issue mentioned below. But at least it isn't just limited to a few of them. Best part is that you don't have multiple spam messages all along your Facebook wall from your parents trying to get chips from you.

Game runs fine on my machine at least and save for one period where I had issues loading the character customizer, everything is fine on a technical standpoint.

The only thing holding the game back is its lack of players, which due to the social nature of the game seriously harms the game even in this Early Access state. Hopefully once it launches people will give it a look. Maybe if Digital Leisure adds crafting and zombies, people will play it. :)

Some suggestions to the developer for release and beyond:
Figure out some reason for people to use the nightclub, whether its a drink-serving minigame to earn chips or something else worthwile. Seems useless at this point in time. Same with the Hotel Room. I'd love a GTA style TV where you watch pre-made shows but that's way too expensive for this kind of indie development studio. A possible area for user-generated content perhaps?

More slot and video blackjack variations.

Poker and Blackjack tournaments.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very basic sim with very little excitement.  Might be better with consistent players, but probably not much.  All the games are very generic, without any of the themes or personality that make casinos fun.

The poker room is pretty disappointing, and I don't see any sign in the early access notes of there being plans for any sort of major overhaul here. It's not at all like an actual casino poker room, and seems like it's been designed by someone who doesn't know much about poker. There is no cash games, only sit-and-go style tournaments with extremely fast blind levels that tend to turn the game into an all-in festival within minutes. There is no variety in games. The tables don't even have enough seats for a typical casino poker game. The poker setup seems geared toward getting games over with as quickly as possible.

reviewText:
I had a dance party in the bingo room...

...with a group that looked very similar to Nsync

and there's poker too!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Okay, for reals, this game is good! I have never found any gamebreaking bugs anywhere or I have never been forced to pay at any point (heck, the only things I've found that you need to pay for were the cosmetics.)

Pros:
Decent explaination of how to play the various games.

Emphasis on the SOCIAL aspects of the games. Note the bingo room dance party.

Virtually nonexistant microtransactions. You can buy clothes that do nothing if you would like to support the dev.

The game throws more free money at you than a rapper in Scrooge McDuck's money bin. No joke, one of the tasks says Get your free daily credits -> Get 250 free credits" They give you money FOR GETTING MONEY

Cons:
Its nigh impossible to join a poker table. There's so many people trying to play the "Daily Free Poker" that it looks like a rugby game

I know this is nitpicking but I wish there was rave music in the Nightclub but thats just my opinion

reviewText: I was really enjoying the game for the first 30 or so hours since I was gaining lots of chips while going back and forth between all the games, but it went all down hill when I rushed to get VIP status to write about it on my site and lost all of my chips in the process. I'm actually kind of glad I did lose all of my chips since I was able to find out how terrible the game is when you're out of chips. Even with VIP status, which doubles all of the free chips that I can earn, I just can't earn chips anymore from playing games. This was my experience when I had a lot of good luck early on in the game, imagine what it would be like to constantly lose with the chips that you begin the game with and run out not even an hour into playing. I might have even considered spending some money on a cosmetic or two, but there is no way I'd do that when the game can become boring in an instant. It doesn't help when the daily free slots has bugged out on me and not giving me any chips, even when I match three in a row. This is also the first free game that I have tried where you can't even PLAY it without having chips, unless you just want to play free poker 24/7. That would be like playing a free shooter game where it limits how many matches you can play, and losing matches decreases the amount of times you can play, until finally you are forced to buy more matches.\n\nI would change it so the free chips that you earn over time gives you a small amount even if you aren't online, even 10% of their normal value would be enough to help people off the floor. This could even earn you too many over a long period, so a chip cap should also be in place.

reviewText:
I'll start off by saying I reccomend this game but I would give it a 6/10 overall.
I am a ps4 player who played for about a month put $30 into the game and got over 150k rp within that time period.
We'll start with the bads,
gameplay gets a 4/10... no matter what you play the odds are against you just like a real casino making it nearly impossible to build up a decent amount of chips even from smart bets. Another big thing is the constant glitches and bugs riddled throughout the game that can make it obnoxious to play at times and even cause to lose chips. You can play this game for free, but the amount of chips they supply you with are minimal and very easy to lose so most likely this will be a pay to play game for you. The four points I gave it is simply because it is a casino and who doesn't love gambling.
graphics gets a 7/10... I did enjoy the graphics although there are many bugs with the emotes and things seem to be pretty cartoony (hey what do you expect) it's not very realistic but it gets the job done.
customer service gets a 9/10... they are quick to refund lost chips due to their glitches and provide needed help, but one night I had a huge error in the game and they simply ignored my direct messages on facebook to their company (their page isn't even busy) which simply cannot allow me to give them a 10/10.

This game is very addicting but can also be a money sink which is bad because in reality their prices for chips are absolutely horrible and if you aren't careful about your bets you could blow through $20 in a few days. In the end i decided the game was pointless and just decided to go all in on one number on roulette (75 spins) 10k bet and it didn't hit my number a single time (WHAT ARE THE ODDS??). So I would say check this game out it's pretty fun for a while but whatever you do don't put money into this rigged game as you will never win.

reviewText:
This game has real potential, and a real place in the market seeing as it is the only multiplayer poker game on steam (something we really need).
And while the graphics are pretty, and the idea of the hub world where you can find all the different types of poker is fun, the game is just too shoddy in the technical side of things to be recommended.
Yes, it is in early access and will improve as time goes on, that does not mean a game can be released in a such a ♥♥♥♥ state.
It constantly freezes, players will disappear, it will crash unexpectedly (causing me to lose a lot of chips), and has an atrocious frame rate.
Its not too good from a gameplay perspective, as nearly everyone is playing Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em so you can find barely anyone to play other games with, such as roulette. And when you do want to play Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em, all the tables are taken up!
Overall, the game has real promise, but in its current state, only touch this pile of ♥♥♥♥ with a stick longer than it takes for you to find an empty blackjack table!

reviewText:
I'll start off by saying I reccomend this game but I would give it a 6/10 overall.
I am a ps4 player who played for about a month put $30 into the game and got over 150k rp within that time period.
We'll start with the bads,
gameplay gets a 4/10... no matter what you play the odds are against you just like a real casino making it nearly impossible to build up a decent amount of chips even from smart bets. Another big thing is the constant glitches and bugs riddled throughout the game that can make it obnoxious to play at times and even cause to lose chips. You can play this game for free, but the amount of chips they supply you with are minimal and very easy to lose so most likely this will be a pay to play game for you. The four points I gave it is simply because it is a casino and who doesn't love gambling.
graphics gets a 7/10... I did enjoy the graphics although there are many bugs with the emotes and things seem to be pretty cartoony (hey what do you expect) it's not very realistic but it gets the job done.
customer service gets a 9/10... they are quick to refund lost chips due to their glitches and provide needed help, but one night I had a huge error in the game and they simply ignored my direct messages on facebook to their company (their page isn't even busy) which simply cannot allow me to give them a 10/10.

This game is very addicting but can also be a money sink which is bad because in reality their prices for chips are absolutely horrible and if you aren't careful about your bets you could blow through $20 in a few days. In the end i decided the game was pointless and just decided to go all in on one number on roulette (75 spins) 10k bet and it didn't hit my number a single time (WHAT ARE THE ODDS??). So I would say check this game out it's pretty fun for a while but whatever you do don't put money into this rigged game as you will never win.
