reviewText: Awesome game!!! I found The Four Kings Casino while searching for a game i could play together with my son ... and i've found the best place to play several casino games, hang out with my son & meet other people from all around the world :). reviewText:
From the ashes of Playstation Home comes The Four Kings Casino and Slots.


When Home's closure was announced near the end of 2014 its 3rd party Devs, one of which was Digital Leisure, freaked out and quickly started up new projects since their easy cash stream was about to go bye-bye. Digital Leisure opted to turn their Paradise Springs Casino area into a stand alone game. So they rebuilt it and renamed it The Four Kings Casino and Slots. As an attempt to lure Home users to it they decided to try and emulate Home. Sadly though they decided to emulate Home as it was near the end of its life. So the game is a bit shoddy, users suggestions are ignored most of the time, and they're more interested pushing cash store vanity items that have sod all to do with a casino (like pets and doofy avatar zoning in and out animations).

Like Playstaion Home was, this game is something that could be fun but is ruined by the cheap cash grab mentality of the Devs.

Cannot recommend.

ok, this game has some potential to being fun. but thats only if you invest real money into it. to get enough chips at one time, to give you enough play time to enjoy the game. otherwise, you spend more time waiting for 250 chips to arrive maybe every 15 minutes, and the acassional 250 chips they hide in the casino. now the problem with this is with 250 chips every 15 min. you can play a single hand of video poker at the lowest bet possible. where is the fun in that? it's no place. the lowest bet possible on slots is 8 on only a single machine. which thats not to bad, if, and i mean IF you get lucky. otherwise the 250 chips every 15 min, is gone in less then 5 min. there is a couple free to play poker tables, that usually just get cluttered with people that want to bet all right off the bat. this game is basicly designed to force you to spend real money to win fake money that don't last for nothing. 90% of the games cost way to much, making the game to just be a money sink.

cost of playing:
video poker (jacks or better only machines)   min bet 200chips-max 1000chips
slots (only 3 different machines)   min bet 8chips-max ???chips (never had enough chips to play a max bet)
video blackjack   min bet 100chips-max 1000chips
blackjack table   min bet 50 chips-max ???chips
poker table (texas holdem only)   min bet 100chips-max ???chips
rollett table   min bet 50chips-max ???chips
craps table   minbet 50chips-max ???chips
bingo   min 3000chips

basicly every thing costs alot of chips compaired to the money you have to spend to make the game worth while playing.  my suggestion is, if you want to invest real money into a casino game, then invest into one that you can win real money on, OR find one for sale that don't involve constantly needing to purchase chips and only has a one time purchase price tag. or go on facebook or windows store and find some free ones that give you enough chips to actually have fun with before your forced to purchase chips.

this game wouldn't have a bad review from me if everything was a little more realisticly priced. this game does have potental, and could be tons of fun even with the lack of variety of slots, poker machines, and poker tables.

reviewText:
Having put 1400 hours into this game, I think I am well placed to give a review from the perspective of an experienced player. I'd like to give an honest and unbiased review, which can be taken at face value.

The concept of this game is brilliant and it is the only game of its kind I have ever seen. It is full of potential and could have been one of the greatest free to play games of the decade. It offers an immersive casino experience, with many of the most common casino games. On the other hand, there are many reasons that this game fails to fulfill that potential.

Primarily the poker is a joke. The only game available is single table 6 player hyper turbo short stack tournaments. They can be fun in the short term, if the cards fall your way, but it completely negates any element of skill. You start with 50k and a 1k big blind. After 10 minutes, the blinds are 8k. Even in a tight game with good playets, you're at the stage where it's all in or fold after about 20 mins. Some people obviously like this pure gambling format, but to me, the point of poker is that skill can overcome chance in the long run. With this format though, you're forced into ridiculous all-ins with hands like K8 vs Q6 all pre-flop.

The devs have categorically refused to change this format over the last 4 months and have indicated that they have no plans to improve this joke format.

They have 3 slot machines. The 888 slots (the original) is quite slow and boring, with the only bonus being free spins, which still don't pay very much. They introduced a second machine, Spinning Cogs, which has a bonus round but still bores you to death and very rarely pays out. The 3rd slot machine 'Big Top' has a decent concept with a bonus round but still pays peanuts. Even a perfect bonus round only pays 90k for a 3k bet. The main money is to be made by hitting the wild symbols, which usually come up in the 3rd to 5th reel, therefore paying nothing. Even 4 wilds in the first 4 reels only pays around 100k.

Black Jack is available, but you have to play perfect strategy and even then you're lucky to break even. This may be the closest to real casino play that this shambles of a virtual casino offers.

Roulette is on offer too. If you play roulette you have to expect to lose in the long run. Big 6 wheel is an option but it is slow and boring and not a good way to make money. It runs smoothly at least in my experience.

Bingo games run with up to 40 players, but it is agonisingly slow, even with the auto dauber (which costs as much as a few beers). You endure multiple false calls and a juvenile chat crowd with no moderation. Racism and sexism go unpunished, unless you can be bothered to find the offender and run up to them, wait for them to stand still, open your menu and report them.

War, which may as well be a heads or tails coin toss is another option.

VIP status offers Baccarat along with the chance to lose even more at all the other games.

The developers are happy to accept multiple accounts from the same IP, same person even, as long as you don't play poker together.

There are a number of hacks available, including one which allows the cheater to view all players' poker cards. The devs seem unable to counter these hacks.

If you want a game where you can log on for 10 minutes a day and gamble a bit, you might love this. If you want a community that  enjoys gambling and takes an interest in odds, poker and improving their all around skills, this is not the game for you. The devs would rather spend time designing pets than fix bugs or increase the gambling options available to the loyal players. Poker players are especially neglected in this pay to win game.

Download this if you want to be a guinea-pig for the console version that the devs admit is their priority.

reviewText:
This used to be a fun and enjoyable game. It must have been, I have just over 500 hours in it. I met a lot of good people here, enjoyed playing poker and slots the most. Now I have at least four times more people on my block list than friends list. As I write this I am in the VIP room on Saturday night and none else is here, at all. The game used to have a reason to want to level up in VIP ranking, to get more free chips. VIP 3 received 1000 chips every 15 minutes, now the devs took that away and everyone gets 250. I see no reason to want to keep playing to level up for no apparent reason after all the time I spent reaching nobility.


This is my opinion, but it also seems that payoffs have been drastically reduced. My wife and everyone I talked to in the game believe the same. All I know is I I used to have almost a million chips, now I have les than 10 K, and not from extreme bets. The devs seem to be doing everything possible to get people to spend money in the game. That is understandable as the game is free, at least on pc. With no incentive to want to increase level, less and less friends in the game and less chance of winning in games, I see no reason to stay in the game, much less spend money in it.

As I said, this was an enjoyable way to spend time, now I'm bored of it and noone staying in it. btw, there is nothing in clothing or pets I want to buy either. So now I have decided to uninstall a game I used to enjoy a lot. Make up your own mind about the game, but I think the devs destroyed it in a money grab.

Oh, did I mention the glitches, which are getting worse and not better? Nothing is as frustrating as being in a poker or even bingo game and getting booted out of it in the middle. The devs are good at refunding chips when it happens, but the idea of gambling in a casino is the chance to win money, not get your money back. You can wait 10 or more minutes for a bingo game to actually start, instead of the usual 2, if too many people didnt walk out of the game by then, leaving less than the required 3 to play. Or when you are about to win the table in poker and suddenly find yourself standing outside the table and your chips are gone, as well as your chance of winning.

There are just too many reasons for me to not want to play the game anymore and not nearly enough reasons for me to want to stay in it.

reviewText:
This game has real potential, and a real place in the market seeing as it is the only multiplayer poker game on steam (something we really need).
And while the graphics are pretty, and the idea of the hub world where you can find all the different types of poker is fun, the game is just too shoddy in the technical side of things to be recommended.
Yes, it is in early access and will improve as time goes on, that does not mean a game can be released in a such a ♥♥♥♥ state.
It constantly freezes, players will disappear, it will crash unexpectedly (causing me to lose a lot of chips), and has an atrocious frame rate.
Its not too good from a gameplay perspective, as nearly everyone is playing Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em so you can find barely anyone to play other games with, such as roulette. And when you do want to play Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em, all the tables are taken up!
Overall, the game has real promise, but in its current state, only touch this pile of ♥♥♥♥ with a stick longer than it takes for you to find an empty blackjack table!

reviewText:
Having put 1400 hours into this game, I think I am well placed to give a review from the perspective of an experienced player. I'd like to give an honest and unbiased review, which can be taken at face value.

The concept of this game is brilliant and it is the only game of its kind I have ever seen. It is full of potential and could have been one of the greatest free to play games of the decade. It offers an immersive casino experience, with many of the most common casino games. On the other hand, there are many reasons that this game fails to fulfill that potential.

Primarily the poker is a joke. The only game available is single table 6 player hyper turbo short stack tournaments. They can be fun in the short term, if the cards fall your way, but it completely negates any element of skill. You start with 50k and a 1k big blind. After 10 minutes, the blinds are 8k. Even in a tight game with good playets, you're at the stage where it's all in or fold after about 20 mins. Some people obviously like this pure gambling format, but to me, the point of poker is that skill can overcome chance in the long run. With this format though, you're forced into ridiculous all-ins with hands like K8 vs Q6 all pre-flop.

The devs have categorically refused to change this format over the last 4 months and have indicated that they have no plans to improve this joke format.

They have 3 slot machines. The 888 slots (the original) is quite slow and boring, with the only bonus being free spins, which still don't pay very much. They introduced a second machine, Spinning Cogs, which has a bonus round but still bores you to death and very rarely pays out. The 3rd slot machine 'Big Top' has a decent concept with a bonus round but still pays peanuts. Even a perfect bonus round only pays 90k for a 3k bet. The main money is to be made by hitting the wild symbols, which usually come up in the 3rd to 5th reel, therefore paying nothing. Even 4 wilds in the first 4 reels only pays around 100k.

Black Jack is available, but you have to play perfect strategy and even then you're lucky to break even. This may be the closest to real casino play that this shambles of a virtual casino offers.

Roulette is on offer too. If you play roulette you have to expect to lose in the long run. Big 6 wheel is an option but it is slow and boring and not a good way to make money. It runs smoothly at least in my experience.

Bingo games run with up to 40 players, but it is agonisingly slow, even with the auto dauber (which costs as much as a few beers). You endure multiple false calls and a juvenile chat crowd with no moderation. Racism and sexism go unpunished, unless you can be bothered to find the offender and run up to them, wait for them to stand still, open your menu and report them.

War, which may as well be a heads or tails coin toss is another option.

VIP status offers Baccarat along with the chance to lose even more at all the other games.

The developers are happy to accept multiple accounts from the same IP, same person even, as long as you don't play poker together.

There are a number of hacks available, including one which allows the cheater to view all players' poker cards. The devs seem unable to counter these hacks.

If you want a game where you can log on for 10 minutes a day and gamble a bit, you might love this. If you want a community that  enjoys gambling and takes an interest in odds, poker and improving their all around skills, this is not the game for you. The devs would rather spend time designing pets than fix bugs or increase the gambling options available to the loyal players. Poker players are especially neglected in this pay to win game.

Download this if you want to be a guinea-pig for the console version that the devs admit is their priority.

reviewText:
This used to be a fun and enjoyable game. It must have been, I have just over 500 hours in it. I met a lot of good people here, enjoyed playing poker and slots the most. Now I have at least four times more people on my block list than friends list. As I write this I am in the VIP room on Saturday night and none else is here, at all. The game used to have a reason to want to level up in VIP ranking, to get more free chips. VIP 3 received 1000 chips every 15 minutes, now the devs took that away and everyone gets 250. I see no reason to want to keep playing to level up for no apparent reason after all the time I spent reaching nobility.


This is my opinion, but it also seems that payoffs have been drastically reduced. My wife and everyone I talked to in the game believe the same. All I know is I I used to have almost a million chips, now I have les than 10 K, and not from extreme bets. The devs seem to be doing everything possible to get people to spend money in the game. That is understandable as the game is free, at least on pc. With no incentive to want to increase level, less and less friends in the game and less chance of winning in games, I see no reason to stay in the game, much less spend money in it.

As I said, this was an enjoyable way to spend time, now I'm bored of it and noone staying in it. btw, there is nothing in clothing or pets I want to buy either. So now I have decided to uninstall a game I used to enjoy a lot. Make up your own mind about the game, but I think the devs destroyed it in a money grab.

Oh, did I mention the glitches, which are getting worse and not better? Nothing is as frustrating as being in a poker or even bingo game and getting booted out of it in the middle. The devs are good at refunding chips when it happens, but the idea of gambling in a casino is the chance to win money, not get your money back. You can wait 10 or more minutes for a bingo game to actually start, instead of the usual 2, if too many people didnt walk out of the game by then, leaving less than the required 3 to play. Or when you are about to win the table in poker and suddenly find yourself standing outside the table and your chips are gone, as well as your chance of winning.

There are just too many reasons for me to not want to play the game anymore and not nearly enough reasons for me to want to stay in it.

reviewText:
From the ashes of Playstation Home comes The Four Kings Casino and Slots.


When Home's closure was announced near the end of 2014 its 3rd party Devs, one of which was Digital Leisure, freaked out and quickly started up new projects since their easy cash stream was about to go bye-bye. Digital Leisure opted to turn their Paradise Springs Casino area into a stand alone game. So they rebuilt it and renamed it The Four Kings Casino and Slots. As an attempt to lure Home users to it they decided to try and emulate Home. Sadly though they decided to emulate Home as it was near the end of its life. So the game is a bit shoddy, users suggestions are ignored most of the time, and they're more interested pushing cash store vanity items that have sod all to do with a casino (like pets and doofy avatar zoning in and out animations).

Like Playstaion Home was, this game is something that could be fun but is ruined by the cheap cash grab mentality of the Devs.

Cannot recommend.

multi-player online
able to walk around
concept

the OK:

the bad:

ok, this game has some potential to being fun. but thats only if you invest real money into it. to get enough chips at one time, to give you enough play time to enjoy the game. otherwise, you spend more time waiting for 250 chips to arrive maybe every 15 minutes, and the acassional 250 chips they hide in the casino. now the problem with this is with 250 chips every 15 min. you can play a single hand of video poker at the lowest bet possible. where is the fun in that? it's no place. the lowest bet possible on slots is 8 on only a single machine. which thats not to bad, if, and i mean IF you get lucky. otherwise the 250 chips every 15 min, is gone in less then 5 min. there is a couple free to play poker tables, that usually just get cluttered with people that want to bet all right off the bat. this game is basicly designed to force you to spend real money to win fake money that don't last for nothing. 90% of the games cost way to much, making the game to just be a money sink.

cost of playing:
video poker (jacks or better only machines)   min bet 200chips-max 1000chips
slots (only 3 different machines)   min bet 8chips-max ???chips (never had enough chips to play a max bet)
video blackjack   min bet 100chips-max 1000chips
blackjack table   min bet 50 chips-max ???chips
poker table (texas holdem only)   min bet 100chips-max ???chips
rollett table   min bet 50chips-max ???chips
craps table   minbet 50chips-max ???chips
bingo   min 3000chips

basicly every thing costs alot of chips compaired to the money you have to spend to make the game worth while playing.  my suggestion is, if you want to invest real money into a casino game, then invest into one that you can win real money on, OR find one for sale that don't involve constantly needing to purchase chips and only has a one time purchase price tag. or go on facebook or windows store and find some free ones that give you enough chips to actually have fun with before your forced to purchase chips.

this game wouldn't have a bad review from me if everything was a little more realisticly priced. this game does have potental, and could be tons of fun even with the lack of variety of slots, poker machines, and poker tables.

reviewText:
I have played this game quite a bit, and while fun I do think that it suffers from some major issues.

First, the games are stacked into the casino's favor WAY more than a normal casino.  I know it sounds like I'm just being idiotic, but I started testing a few things in the game.  First, when playing slots you almost never hit bonuses. Once in 200 spins or so seems to be the average.  If you've ever been to a real casino, you know bonuses are a lot more common.  In fact the payout on the slot machines is ridiculous.  You can expect to lose 75% of the money you put into the slot machine over about 10 spins.  Slots are money losers, I know, but 75% over 10 spins, nine out of ten times? Come on.  Yes you can go on win streaks, but its as though when the game feels you have built up enough using a Martingale system (doubling your bet after you lose), it will make sure you keep losing.  You can go up to max bet and lose, which is normal using that system.  But to continue losing 10 more bets after that?

Not convinced?  Blackjack.  I counted the number of cards between yellow cards.  Instead of the standard 6 decks.. there is 4.5.. not 4, not 5.. but 4.5.  So which cards are extra and who gets which? Go ahead, try it.  You can bet 15 times in a row using basic blackjack strat and not win a single round.  Meanwhile the dealer will pull 14, or 16.. and they will get just enough to beat you.

Why?  Well, the problem is the whole pay-to-play structure.  While it would take a lengthy amount of time to lose your chips making minimum bets, you will never make VIP.  VIP allows you to play Baccarat (not available on the normal floor), as well as play higher stakes games, and a few other perks. You earn VIP status through earning Reward Points.  You earn Reward Points for winning bets.  The higher the bet, the more reward points you are eligible for.  It takes a lot of grinding.  So couple the fact with you need to win big bets (or play long nonsensical hours (probably 8 hours a day for minimum bets)) with the fact that the game in tilted more in the odds of the casino than a normal casino.. you come to the realization that if you enjoy playing the games enough you need to purchase chips.

I don't mind paying the developer for the game, I understand a developer deserves to get paid for their product.  But atleast make it fair.  If I spend money I want atleast a chance to win.  Either make us pay for the product, or find another way to make revenue.. because it sucks supporting a game by buying more chips, just to lose them on their broken system.  I'd rather not spend more than a set amount on a game without getting some actual content.  Just my opinion.

Why?  Well, the problem is the whole pay-to-play structure.  While it would take a lengthy amount of time to lose your chips making minimum bets, you will never make VIP.  VIP allows you to play Baccarat (not available on the normal floor), as well as play higher stakes games, and a few other perks. You earn VIP status through earning Reward Points.  You earn Reward Points for winning bets.  The higher the bet, the more reward points you are eligible for.  It takes a lot of grinding.  So couple the fact with you need to win big bets (or play long nonsensical hours (probably 8 hours a day for minimum bets)) with the fact that the game in tilted more in the odds of the casino than a normal casino.. you come to the realization that if you enjoy playing the games enough you need to purchase chips.

I don't mind paying the developer for the game, I understand a developer deserves to get paid for their product.  But atleast make it fair.  If I spend money I want atleast a chance to win.  Either make us pay for the product, or find another way to make revenue.. because it sucks supporting a game by buying more chips, just to lose them on their broken system.  I'd rather not spend more than a set amount on a game without getting some actual content.  Just my opinion.

reviewText:
PC Specs (If you care):
~
Alienware 15 R2 Laptop
Intel Core i7 6700HQ CPU @ 2.6 ghz Turbo Boosted at 3.5 ghz, 4 Cores, 8 Logical Processors
8gbs RAM
Nvidia Geforce GTX 970M
Windows 10 Home
~
The Four Kings Casino and Slots is what the title says it is, a casino. It's a third person online casino where you can make friends, customize your character and  play casino games like slots, blackjack, and poker. It has a chips system and everything for you to be immersed into the game and feel as if it's a real casino. Let's get right down to the aspects of the game and how they work really well with it.
~
Pros:
-Great Graphics
-Alot of Casino Games to Chose From
-Multiplayer
-Nice Community

Cons:
-Buggy
-Insane FPS Drops (Occasionally)
-Unfair Dealers (More Below)
~
Clearing up the Microtransactions:
You might automatically turn this game down because you've heard about microtransactions. Whatever you do, don't do that thing that I just said. You CAN but are not FORCED to buy chips with real money. It is COMPLETELY OPTIONAL and you can get chips from playing the games, waiting 15 minutes for your free 200 chips, getting your daily chips, doing your daily or weekly tasks. I just listed off 4 ways you can get chips do you realise how UNNESSASARY buying chips is. If you complain abut the buying of chips just stop it.
~
Unfair Dealers:
I've heard many people talk about the unfair dealers and I too have experienced it. In Blackjack when you're playing the dealer will seem very unfair at times. Lets say me and the dealer are against each other and I get a 12 and I hit, I'll automatically get a 22. Lets do this again, I get a 4 the dealer has a 17, I hit and get 7 he hits and gets 21. Where's the equality? This happens alot of times and I lost 2,000 chips to this happening many times in a row. It seems as if when you play with more people the dealer becomes more fair though.
~
Games:
-Many different types of slots
-Bingo
-Blackjack
-Poker
-Video Blackjack
-Jacks or Better
-Keno

Overall this game has some great potential and I'm glad that this is a thing. I highly recommend it to anybody who likes casino games alot.

7/10

Purchasing chip packages just eats through your funds and well i went from having 50k chips to winning 30k chips but rather than it adding it to my balance my balance stayed the same and then on the 2nd time it happened i thought about reporting it but who would believe you the games have no transaction id and unless your recording your gameplay it's your word against theirs, even more so when you relise that once you pump your cash into the game there's no reverse option you can only put funds in they don't pay funds out to your steam balance or give you anything you can sell on the marketplace to re-coop your real cash spent.

My advice avoid unless you like those facebook games that are usually free but have tons of microtransactions where you'll find yourself no better off than gambling for real!

reviewText:
Ok, I can now make a good review of this game. It is going to get a 3 out of 10.

The games themselves feel good, when they are working. It is like visiting a casino, playing games, winning money, losing money. It seems random enough that it feels like going on good or bad luck streaks, and sometimes you make a ton, and sometimes you lose a ton.

The framerate is still crap, there are times that my framerate locks to 0 FPS when the server has alot of people on it. Some of the games are buggy, just had an issue where it was as if the dealer had passed out on the table because I sat for almost 10 minutes after putting my bet in before it gave me my cards. Currently there is a bug on the roulette tables that I have reported and it should be being investigated. It honestly feels like this game should still be in early access. If it was in early access I could excuse the bugs and the framerate, and it would potentially have a 8 or 9 out of 10, but with this being it's final release
date:
(yes, I know they will and are updating it with content and bug fixes) it is rather inexcusable to have this many bugs.

Honestly if these devs would get their ♥♥♥♥ together and crack down on the optimization and bugs, this would be a really good game. But until then, I stand by my 3 out of 10 rating.

Final Edit: These devs are not very bright. Instead of fixing the framerate issues, they have added pets, which makes the framerate even worse. The playerbase for this game is all but non existant at this point with a peak of 112 people playing at once in the last 24 hours. If the devs do not get their crap together they are going to be left with an empty shell of a game, at least on PC, I cannot speak for the future console users. Bottom line, this game is not worth the time to download. Maybe sometime in the near future we will see a new dev bring a new casino that actually works. Until then, I'm cutting my losses and cashing in my chips.

reviewText:
Alright, i think the time has come to write a review for this game. I started playing the game on 4th or 5th of june and Steam says that the game ran for over 432 hours. I didn't actually play for all these hours, but i still played A LOT. I have played this game for about 25 days, which means that it ran for 17+ hours on average every day. With that amount of time you can safely say that i am a hardcore gamer and enjoyed it most of the time. I also recently became a volunteer as a translator for Digital Leisure, which is the company that created this game. For a long time i was not sure if i give this game a positive or a negative review, but after the Blackjack tournament that happened last weekend i finally made my decision, but more to this later.

Four Kings Casino and Slots is a casino simulation. A virtual casino where you create an avatar and play popular casino games like Blackjack, Slots, Craps, Video Poker and others. In every game, except Poker, there is a house edge like in a real casino. So, if you like gambling and losing your chips most of the time then this game could get you somewhat addicted.

The game was fully released out of early access on june the 1st with many bugs, errors and easy ways for people to cheat. Especially within about the first 1-2 weeks the game was plagued by cheaters and bugs. They definitely released this game too early and after almost a month now it still feels like you are playing a beta/early access version. I still don't understand why they did that.

It is free to play, so how are they making their money? First there is a shop where you can buy cosmetic items like clothes for your avatar and then you can buy chips with real money.

As a new player you get 10k chips to play with, which sounds good at the beginning, but it is not a lot. You can lose them quickly if you are not careful enough. Especially for Poker players it can be painful, because the buy-in at a Poker table is 5k. So, if you lose two Poker games then you are already broke. There are some ways how you can get free chips and i will list them for you:
-Every 15 minutes you can pick up 250 free chips at the chip station.
-Once per day you can play at the free Poker table and only the winner can get 5k. There is only 1 free Poker table in the room, so you will have to wait and sometimes be fast, because there are many players waiting.
-Every now and then there is also a free Bingo game and depending on the number of players you can win some chips. With the maximum of 40 players it is 10k if i remember correctly, but good luck winning one of these.
-5 daily tasks where you get 200 chips for completing each one of them and an additional 600 if you complete them all. Most of them are very easy like using an emote, playing at the free Poker table or dancing in the nightclub.
-5 weekly tasks. You get 2k for completing each one of them and right now i don't remember how much you can get when you complete them all. Some of them are ridiculous like earning 1000 RP at Keno or Slots. Don't even try if you don't have many chips.

I mentioned RP and this is like a second currency in the game that allows you to buy items in the shops like clothes. You mostly earn RP by winning chips and if you earn enough within a month you can get vip status for a month, which gives you some benefits. You earn RP depending on how many chips you bet/win. There are leaderboards for every game and there is a global leaderboard that are based on the RP you earn. Players who buy chips for money have a big advantage to get to the top of the leaderboards - they are kind of pay to win since these players can max bet all the time and don't have to worry about losing the chips.

There were many errors and bugs. Some of them have been more or less fixed and some games have been improved, but there are still enough that it's annoying to some degree. If you run a casino then functionality is the most important thing. In Four Kings Casino and Slots you can lose chips to bugs and this is kind of ridiculous, because there are people who pay money for their chips. Tables can glitch and become unplayable, players get kicked off tables, game crashes, disconnects and people lose some chips when things like that happen. It also happened to me that one time i didn't receive the chips for completing the daily tasks. You can request chip refunds through the bug report system in the game and most of the time they will give you back your lost chips, but not always. It happened at least twice to me that i can definitely remember where they just didn't refund the chips that i lost although i made these bug reports. Again, especially painful for the players who spent money for their chips. Within the first 2 or 3 weeks the game often felt like a chip refund simulator and not a casino simulation. It is better now, but you can still lose chips to bugs, make a chip refund request through the bug report tool and not receive the chips that you lost. I would not recommend spending money in that game unless you really don't care. If you go to a real casino they don't just kick you off the table for no reason and keep your chips.

So, there was a Blackjack tournament last weekend and i saved up enough chips to play. First, Digital Leisure posted wrong information about the tournament on the Steam discussion board where they always post their information about the tournaments. For example, they wrote that the tournament would be split into segments of 2 hours each and there was also a overall leaderboard. In reality these segments were just 1 hour each. After 3 or 4 hours of the tournament running they restarted the server to make some fixes. Great timing, isn't it? Unfortunately and to my anger these fixes" still didn't help to prevent some bugs happening. For example
date: if you played to the end of a 1 hour segment and let the extra time fully run out your score did not count
recommended: but if you stood up a few seconds earlier your score did count. They didn't tell us anything about that before.\nOn the second day of the tournament i had to experience it myself where i made a score that was enough for overall 3rd place
hoursPlayed: but it didn't count because the timer fully ran out. I had a pretty high score already at 3rd place
voteText: but this one was only good enough for place 5 at the end. It also happened to other players and we made a post about it on the discussion board. A Digital Leisure employee responded in that thread and said that we should make screenshots next time. Are you kidding me? It was not our fault
helpfulPercent: it was a fault on their side. He also said that the score of ALL players in this thread would be corrected and they did
votesHelpful: but not with mine. There was a player who had a higher score than i previously had and he posted after me. He got his score corrected
votesTotal: but i didn't get my score corrected. When i mentioned that they forgot me he only said that it wouldn't affect MY payout and still didn't correct my score. What a joke since before that he posted that the payouts would also be corrected by the team. At the end i only ended up at rank 5 instead of rank 3 on the overall tournament leaderboard. Their game bug cost me 2 places and a better payout.\nOn the final day of the tournament i had 2 really
votesFunny: really good runs that had great potential to make the best score and reach rank 1 in the whole tournament. In one of these runs i had it for sure. My luck and my earnings were crazy this time. I was almost alone in a room sitting at an empty table to play as many hands as possible. I knew it. I saw my score
commentsCount: i saw the time that i had left and suddenly in the middle of these 2 runs the game disconnected me. Very strange that it exactly happened in these 2 runs. I knew what i was doing. I won about 10+ of 48 of the 1 hour tournament segments and made some 2nd and 3rd places. I barely slept this weekend
column16: tried so hard and didn't make it to #1
column17: because of game errors. Unbelievable and ridiculous."

reviewText:
While it currently has zero competition, there are a good number of reasons to avoid playing this game:

1. Buggy, sometimes unplayable experiences that result in the loss of chips-in-play
2. A considerable lack of variety in machine games
3. The VIP room carrot-on-a-stick

Allow me to shed some light on number three. There exists in the game a 'VIP' area unlocked for entry when you achieve a certain amount of 'RP' (your secondary form in-game currency used solely for purchasing aesthetic items).

The amount of points required to unlock the 'VIP' room is absurd, so naturally I was curious as to what lay behind the golden gates. Could it be higher betting caps for machine games? Different, perhaps better machine game backgrounds than the machines in the pleb lobby? I needed to know. Also I was pretty tired of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ castle slots characters.

Took a month to get enough of the damned RP points only to walk in the 'VIP' room and be greeted with the same machines  with the same betting caps. Only difference was I could play Baccarat and a higher cap of Poker. Huge let down.

Oh, and everyone was wearing a horse helmet. This games art direction needs a sharp kick in the ♥♥♥, early access or not.

reviewText:
Alright, let me start my review by stating that I'm going to cover each game that is within the Casino by bracket.  I'm going to be starting with Jacks or Better Video Poker as it will lay the foundation as to why nobody should waste the ten minutes it takes to install this game.

Jacks or Better, Video Poker:

First, if you get a Jack or better... It's not a push and you do not get your bet back.  Second, if you get a pair below Jack, you do not get credit for the pair.  Third and most importantly, it seems you only get a winning hand on average, once in every ten or so plays and usually that's just a pair or three of a kind.

Slots:

Okay, first of all the buy ins to play slots are insainly inflated.  You're talking 88-3,000 chips per spin.  When you play any of these brackets, the big wins" or "jackpots" are squed.  I got a big win with a 3k buy in and the pot was 9
date:
000 chips.  You would have to be insain to play slots in this game for an extended period of time.

Video Blackjack:

This is the only game that doesn't seem to be calibrated to destroy you.  The only game inside this casino I do not have  a poor review for... Yet..

Keno:

My only complaint about this game is that it seems as though your win ratio turns from 1 out of every 9 plays to 1 out of every 3 whenever this game becomes the daily.

Big Wheel 6:

This game seems to be working in the opposit fassion than it normally should.  Obviously
recommended: you should have a statistically higher chance of seeing a 1 or a 2 over any other number correct?  Yet
hoursPlayed: if you were to sit down and bet 5
votesTotal:
and $ you would magically come out ahead almost every single time.  Isn't that curious?

War:

War is supposed to be a game that is literally 50% win ratio.  You're lucky to win 1 out of every 5 hands.  Unless of course
votesFunny: War happens to be the daily.  Then
commentsCount: you are magically coming out ahead always.  Outside of the daily

column17:
in this game.. I've averaged it with about 1/14 or so.  Isn't that curious?  What's crious is it seems to be almost exactly 1/7 when War is the daily. Huh??

Baccarat:

Just like war

column19:
i've hand counted time and again that 90% of ties seem to occur between 12 and 16 times.  Maybe it's because they don't want someone who's rich enough to spam bet come out ahead?  Hmm?  Curious!

Bingo:

It seems you have a 25% chance every time you sit down for the table

can we expect the casino to fetch in some chips towards the pot? NOPE!!!

Regular blackjack and single deck:

Blackjack is one of those games that you should have the statistical advantage over the house simply because the dealer is forced against their will to hit until they reach 17 or higher or bust.  Yet
column27: magically...  It is a mirricle to see the dealer bust in this game.  As a matter of fact

column29:
some witchcraft occurs where the dealer will hit 7 times and get a perfect 21 more often than not.

Roulette:

Finally
column30: we are now starting to talk about a Casino game I enjoy to play.  Why do I enjoy this?  Well

betting on seemingly anything and its seemingly elsewhere the ball finds itself no matter what you do?  You could say I'm a conspiricy therist with regards to roulette in this game but maybe some of my comments coming up will change your opinion.

reviewText:
I'll have to change my review, as this game was released in probably the worst state you could ever expect a game to be released in. Hackers on day one with access to every feature the game had to offer. It's an unfortunately greedy company preying on gambling addictions as you are paying the same price here to play games and not get anything from it as you would any other online casino. It's a legal loophole they're taking advantage of.

Imagine a casino where they host daycare, and you have this game. It is taken over by little boys who run around spamming profanity because the filter makes it 'cool'. Expect the same type of people you would find in a game like League of Legends or CSGO. It's not a mature community, it's not a friendly community, and it's definitely not a social community like you might expect.

Do not play unless you plan on giving away money to play imaginary casino games. Still overrun by hackers; people can see your cards in poker and there's nothing you can do to find out.

reviewText:
This game is seriously rigged. Especially in Blackjack. The times the dealer comes out with 20 and 21 from seemingly impossibly dealt cards is just pure CRAP!

As for the slots well you might as well throw your money away. There is only 3 types as well and trust me they get really boring. They do not pay hardly anything at all and free spins are a joke and the features are just crappy. No excitement at all.

Dont even waste your time.
